metadata.title: CVE-2020-12656 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** gss_mech_free in net/sunrpc/auth_gss/gss_mech_switch.c inthe rpcsec_gss_krb5 implementation in the Linux kernel through 5.6.10 lackscertain domain_release calls, leading to a memory leak. Note: This wasdisputed with the assertion that the issue does not grant any access notalready available. It is a problem that on unloading a specific kernelmodule some memory is leaked, but loading kernel modules is a privilegedoperation. A user could also write a kernel module to consume any amount ofmemory they like and load that replicating the effect of this bug.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1075-aws - 4.4.0-1075.79
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1075.79').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~14.04.1').
